author: Heather McNeill
title: Perth's best pub is... The Ashby Bar and Bistro
text:
Karl Langdon crowned the Ashby Bar and Bistro Perth's top pub. Photo: Ashby Bar and Bistro 
What, no potato? 6PR's Karl Langdon non-plussed by Merrywell steak sandwich A pub boasting a massive outdoor TV screen and $15 feed, frothy and flutter deals has been crowned the 6PR DeBortoli Pub of the Year.
The Ashby Bar and Bistro in Ashby near Wanneroo beat 35 other Perth contenders to take out the title ahead of finalists Kewdale Tavern, Boab Tavern, Cottesloe Hotel, The Royal Bar and Brasserie, Whistling Kite and The Gate Bar and Bistro.
Great value and top service. Photo: The Ashby Bar and Bistro 
Radio 6PR host Karl Langdon had the tough task of rating the pubs over the course of the year before judges from his radio station and WAtoday picked the overall winner.
Advertisement "The judges noted it was a great sports bar with very helpful staff, an excellent selection of daily specials and a fresh and affordable menu," Langdon said.
The pub only opened its doors five months ago.
Grab a pint at the bar. Photo: The Ashby Bar and Bistro 
Venue manager Kallen Bond said the demand for the bar and bistro in the 'untapped' area was so strong it almost ran out of food during its opening long weekend.
"Mid-week on average we're doing about 250 meals and on the weekend we're picking up more than 400 meals a day," Mr Bond said.
The most popular items on the pub's menu are the steak sandwich and the feed, frothy and flutter deal for $15 where diners can enjoy a meal, a middy of beer and a $1 mystery bet at the pub's TAB.
The Ashby Bar and Bistro restaurant. Photo: The Ashby Bar and Bistro 
"When you're $15-a-head you can cover the cost of the whole office with under $100," Mr Bond said.
"Since we've opened we've already had someone win $88 on the mystery bet â€“ at our Ellenbrook venue (The Brook Bar and Bistro) a woman won $3000 with her meal."
The newly crowned top pub features an outdoor beer garden, restaurant, sports bar, TAB and adjoining bottle shop.
The pub has a 7sqm outdoor TV screen for sports fans. Photo: The Ashby Bar and Bistro 
The competition to select the 2015 winner was not without its controversial moments with The Merrywell copping a serve of a different kind from Mr Langdon for failing to serve chips with its steak sandwich .
The Aussie faux pas was only matched by the Subiaco Hotel who Mr Langdon said did not offer the pub classics of a steak or chicken parmigiana on its bar menu, earning them a score of 7.5/10.
The lowest score of the competition went to The Saint George Hotel in Innaloo who received a 5.5/10 for its "ordinary service" and a "dry steak burger."  
The pub was a former finalist in the competition which has previously been won by The Botanica Bar and Bistro and Whistling Kite.
Mr Langdon unofficially crowned The Odin Tavern in Balcatta as the best value for money hotel with the quickest service.
An honourable mention went to Byford Tavern for gifting Mr Langdon "the best chicken parmi I've had in years and a beautiful steak sanga."
